title: Numbers 1:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

title: Numbers 1:2
content: 2 “Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, every male, one by one,

title: Numbers 1:3
content: 3 from twenty years old and upward, all who are able to go out to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall count them by their divisions.

title: Numbers 1:4
content: 4 With you there shall be a man of every tribe, each one head of his fathers’ house.

title: Numbers 1:5
content: 5 These are the names of the men who shall stand with you: Of Reuben: Elizur the son of Shedeur.

title: Numbers 1:6
content: 6 Of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

title: Numbers 1:7
content: 7 Of Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

title: Numbers 1:8
content: 8 Of Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar.

title: Numbers 1:9
content: 9 Of Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon.

title: Numbers 1:10
content: 10 Of the children of Joseph: of Ephraim: Elishama the son of Ammihud; of Manasseh: Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

title: Numbers 1:11
content: 11 Of Benjamin: Abidan the son of Gideoni.

title: Numbers 1:12
content: 12 Of Dan: Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers 1:13
content: 13 Of Asher: Pagiel the son of Ochran.

title: Numbers 1:14
content: 14 Of Gad: Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

title: Numbers 1:15
content: 15 Of Naphtali: Ahira the son of Enan.”

title: Numbers 1:16
content: 16 These are those who were called of the congregation, the princes of the tribes of their fathers; they were the heads of the thousands of Israel.

title: Numbers 1:17
content: 17 Moses and Aaron took these men who are mentioned by name.

title: Numbers 1:18
content: 18 They assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month; and they declared their ancestry by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, one by one.

title: Numbers 1:19
content: 19 As the LORD commanded Moses, so he counted them in the wilderness of Sinai.

title: Numbers 1:20
content: 20 The children of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, one by one, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:21
content: 21 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Reuben, were forty-six thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 1:22
content: 22 Of the children of Simeon, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, those who were counted of it, according to the number of the names, one by one, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:23
content: 23 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Simeon, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

title: Numbers 1:24
content: 24 Of the children of Gad, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:25
content: 25 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Gad, were forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.

title: Numbers 1:26
content: 26 Of the children of Judah, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:27
content: 27 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Judah, were seventy-four thousand six hundred.

title: Numbers 1:28
content: 28 Of the children of Issachar, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:29
content: 29 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 1:30
content: 30 Of the children of Zebulun, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:31
content: 31 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Zebulun, were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 1:32
content: 32 Of the children of Joseph: of the children of Ephraim, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:33
content: 33 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Ephraim, were forty thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 1:34
content: 34 Of the children of Manasseh, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:35
content: 35 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Manasseh, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.

title: Numbers 1:36
content: 36 Of the children of Benjamin, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:37
content: 37 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Benjamin, were thirty-five thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 1:38
content: 38 Of the children of Dan, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:39
content: 39 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Dan, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

title: Numbers 1:40
content: 40 Of the children of Asher, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:41
content: 41 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Asher, were forty-one thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 1:42
content: 42 Of the children of Naphtali, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war:

title: Numbers 1:43
content: 43 those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Naphtali, were fifty-three thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 1:44
content: 44 These are those who were counted, whom Moses and Aaron counted, and the twelve men who were princes of Israel, each one for his fathers’ house.

title: Numbers 1:45
content: 45 So all those who were counted of the children of Israel by their fathers’ houses, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war in Israel—

title: Numbers 1:46
content: 46 all those who were counted were six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.

title: Numbers 1:47
content: 47 But the Levites after the tribe of their fathers were not counted among them.

title: Numbers 1:48
content: 48 For the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 1:49
content: 49 “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not count, neither shall you take a census of them among the children of Israel;

title: Numbers 1:50
content: 50 but appoint the Levites over the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and over all its furnishings, and over all that belongs to it. They shall carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; and they shall take care of it, and shall encamp around it.

title: Numbers 1:51
content: 51 When the tabernacle is to move, the Levites shall take it down; and when the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites shall set it up. The stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

title: Numbers 1:52
content: 52 The children of Israel shall pitch their tents, every man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard, according to their divisions.

title: Numbers 1:53
content: 53 But the Levites shall encamp around the Tabernacle of the Testimony, that there may be no wrath on the congregation of the children of Israel. The Levites shall be responsible for the Tabernacle of the Testimony.”

title: Numbers 1:54
content: 54 Thus the children of Israel did. According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so they did.

title: Numbers 2:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 2:2
content: 2 “The children of Israel shall encamp every man by his own standard, with the banners of their fathers’ houses. They shall encamp around the Tent of Meeting at a distance from it.

title: Numbers 2:3
content: 3 “Those who encamp on the east side toward the sunrise shall be of the standard of the camp of Judah, according to their divisions. The prince of the children of Judah shall be Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

title: Numbers 2:4
content: 4 His division, and those who were counted of them, were seventy-four thousand six hundred.

title: Numbers 2:5
content: 5 “Those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar. The prince of the children of Issachar shall be Nethanel the son of Zuar.

title: Numbers 2:6
content: 6 His division, and those who were counted of it, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 2:7
content: 7 “The tribe of Zebulun: the prince of the children of Zebulun shall be Eliab the son of Helon.

title: Numbers 2:8
content: 8 His division, and those who were counted of it, were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 2:9
content: 9 “All who were counted of the camp of Judah were one hundred eighty-six thousand four hundred, according to their divisions. They shall set out first.

title: Numbers 2:10
content: 10 “On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their divisions. The prince of the children of Reuben shall be Elizur the son of Shedeur.

title: Numbers 2:11
content: 11 His division, and those who were counted of it, were forty-six thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 2:12
content: 12 “Those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon. The prince of the children of Simeon shall be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

title: Numbers 2:13
content: 13 His division, and those who were counted of them, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

title: Numbers 2:14
content: 14 “The tribe of Gad: the prince of the children of Gad shall be Eliasaph the son of Reuel.

title: Numbers 2:15
content: 15 His division, and those who were counted of them, were forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.

title: Numbers 2:16
content: 16 “All who were counted of the camp of Reuben were one hundred fifty-one thousand four hundred fifty, according to their armies. They shall set out second.

title: Numbers 2:17
content: 17 “Then the Tent of Meeting shall set out, with the camp of the Levites in the middle of the camps. As they encamp, so shall they set out, every man in his place, by their standards.

title: Numbers 2:18
content: 18 “On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their divisions. The prince of the children of Ephraim shall be Elishama the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers 2:19
content: 19 His division, and those who were counted of them, were forty thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 2:20
content: 20 “Next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh. The prince of the children of Manasseh shall be Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

title: Numbers 2:21
content: 21 His division, and those who were counted of them, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.

title: Numbers 2:22
content: 22 “The tribe of Benjamin: the prince of the children of Benjamin shall be Abidan the son of Gideoni.

title: Numbers 2:23
content: 23 His army, and those who were counted of them, were thirty-five thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 2:24
content: 24 “All who were counted of the camp of Ephraim were one hundred eight thousand one hundred, according to their divisions. They shall set out third.

title: Numbers 2:25
content: 25 “On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan according to their divisions. The prince of the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers 2:26
content: 26 His division, and those who were counted of them, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

title: Numbers 2:27
content: 27 “Those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher. The prince of the children of Asher shall be Pagiel the son of Ochran.

title: Numbers 2:28
content: 28 His division, and those who were counted of them, were forty-one thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 2:29
content: 29 “The tribe of Naphtali: the prince of the children of Naphtali shall be Ahira the son of Enan.

title: Numbers 2:30
content: 30 His division, and those who were counted of them, were fifty-three thousand four hundred.

title: Numbers 2:31
content: 31 “All who were counted of the camp of Dan were one hundred fifty-seven thousand six hundred. They shall set out last by their standards.”

title: Numbers 2:32
content: 32 These are those who were counted of the children of Israel by their fathers’ houses. All who were counted of the camps according to their armies were six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.

title: Numbers 2:33
content: 33 But the Levites were not counted among the children of Israel, as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 2:34
content: 34 Thus the children of Israel did. According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so they encamped by their standards, and so they set out, everyone by their families, according to their fathers’ houses.

title: Numbers 3:1
content: 1 Now this is the history of the generations of Aaron and Moses in the day that the LORD spoke with Moses in Mount Sinai.

title: Numbers 3:2
content: 2 These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

title: Numbers 3:3
content: 3 These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests who were anointed, whom he consecrated to minister in the priest’s office.

title: Numbers 3:4
content: 4 Nadab and Abihu died before the LORD when they offered strange fire before the LORD in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. Eleazar and Ithamar ministered in the priest’s office in the presence of Aaron their father.

title: Numbers 3:5
content: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 3:6
content: 6 “Bring the tribe of Levi near, and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him.

title: Numbers 3:7
content: 7 They shall keep his requirements, and the requirements of the whole congregation before the Tent of Meeting, to do the service of the tabernacle.

title: Numbers 3:8
content: 8 They shall keep all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting, and the obligations of the children of Israel, to do the service of the tabernacle.

title: Numbers 3:9
content: 9 You shall give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons. They are wholly given to him on the behalf of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 3:10
content: 10 You shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall keep their priesthood, but the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.”

title: Numbers 3:11
content: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 3:12
content: 12 “Behold, I have taken the Levites from among the children of Israel instead of all the firstborn who open the womb among the children of Israel; and the Levites shall be mine,

title: Numbers 3:13
content: 13 for all the firstborn are mine. On the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I made holy to me all the firstborn in Israel, both man and animal. They shall be mine. I am the LORD.”

title: Numbers 3:14
content: 14 The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,

title: Numbers 3:15
content: 15 “Count the children of Levi by their fathers’ houses, by their families. You shall count every male from a month old and upward.”

title: Numbers 3:16
content: 16 Moses counted them according to the LORD’s word, as he was commanded.

title: Numbers 3:17
content: 17 These were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

title: Numbers 3:18
content: 18 These are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.

title: Numbers 3:19
content: 19 The sons of Kohath by their families: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

title: Numbers 3:20
content: 20 The sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.

title: Numbers 3:21
content: 21 Of Gershon was the family of the Libnites, and the family of the Shimeites. These are the families of the Gershonites.

title: Numbers 3:22
content: 22 Those who were counted of them, according to the number of all the males from a month old and upward, even those who were counted of them were seven thousand five hundred.

title: Numbers 3:23
content: 23 The families of the Gershonites shall encamp behind the tabernacle westward.

title: Numbers 3:24
content: 24 Eliasaph the son of Lael shall be the prince of the fathers’ house of the Gershonites.

title: Numbers 3:25
content: 25 The duty of the sons of Gershon in the Tent of Meeting shall be the tabernacle, the tent, its covering, the screen for the door of the Tent of Meeting,

title: Numbers 3:26
content: 26 the hangings of the court, the screen for the door of the court which is by the tabernacle and around the altar, and its cords for all of its service.

title: Numbers 3:27
content: 27 Of Kohath was the family of the Amramites, the family of the Izharites, the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites. These are the families of the Kohathites.

title: Numbers 3:28
content: 28 According to the number of all the males from a month old and upward, there were eight thousand six hundred keeping the requirements of the sanctuary.

title: Numbers 3:29
content: 29 The families of the sons of Kohath shall encamp on the south side of the tabernacle.

title: Numbers 3:30
content: 30 The prince of the fathers’ house of the families of the Kohathites shall be Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.

title: Numbers 3:31
content: 31 Their duty shall be the ark, the table, the lamp stand, the altars, the vessels of the sanctuary with which they minister, the screen, and all its service.

title: Numbers 3:32
content: 32 Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be prince of the princes of the Levites, with the oversight of those who keep the requirements of the sanctuary.

title: Numbers 3:33
content: 33 Of Merari was the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites. These are the families of Merari.

title: Numbers 3:34
content: 34 Those who were counted of them, according to the number of all the males from a month old and upward, were six thousand two hundred.

title: Numbers 3:35
content: 35 The prince of the fathers’ house of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. They shall encamp on the north side of the tabernacle.

title: Numbers 3:36
content: 36 The appointed duty of the sons of Merari shall be the tabernacle’s boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets, all its instruments, all its service,

title: Numbers 3:37
content: 37 the pillars of the court around it, their sockets, their pins, and their cords.

title: Numbers 3:38
content: 38 Those who encamp before the tabernacle eastward, in front of the Tent of Meeting toward the sunrise, shall be Moses, with Aaron and his sons, keeping the requirements of the sanctuary for the duty of the children of Israel. The outsider who comes near shall be put to death.

title: Numbers 3:39
content: 39 All who were counted of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron counted at the commandment of the LORD, by their families, all the males from a month old and upward, were twenty-two thousand.

title: Numbers 3:40
content: 40 The LORD said to Moses, “Count all the firstborn males of the children of Israel from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.

title: Numbers 3:41
content: 41 You shall take the Levites for me—I am the LORD—instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel; and the livestock of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the livestock of the children of Israel.”

title: Numbers 3:42
content: 42 Moses counted, as the LORD commanded him, all the firstborn among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 3:43
content: 43 All the firstborn males according to the number of names from a month old and upward, of those who were counted of them, were twenty-two thousand two hundred seventy-three.

title: Numbers 3:44
content: 44 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 3:45
content: 45 “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock; and the Levites shall be mine. I am the LORD.

title: Numbers 3:46
content: 46 For the redemption of the two hundred seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel who exceed the number of the Levites,

title: Numbers 3:47
content: 47 you shall take five shekels apiece for each one; according to the shekel of the sanctuary you shall take them (the shekel is twenty gerahs);

title: Numbers 3:48
content: 48 and you shall give the money, with which their remainder is redeemed, to Aaron and to his sons.”

title: Numbers 3:49
content: 49 Moses took the redemption money from those who exceeded the number of those who were redeemed by the Levites;

title: Numbers 3:50
content: 50 from the firstborn of the children of Israel he took the money, one thousand three hundred sixty-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary;

title: Numbers 3:51
content: 51 and Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and to his sons, according to the LORD’s word, as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 4:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 4:2
content: 2 “Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their families, by their fathers’ houses,

title: Numbers 4:3
content: 3 from thirty years old and upward even until fifty years old, all who enter into the service to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 4:4
content: 4 “This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting, regarding the most holy things.

title: Numbers 4:5
content: 5 When the camp moves forward, Aaron shall go in with his sons; and they shall take down the veil of the screen, cover the ark of the Testimony with it,

title: Numbers 4:6
content: 6 put a covering of sealskin on it, spread a blue cloth over it, and put in its poles.

title: Numbers 4:7
content: 7 “On the table of show bread they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the dishes, the spoons, the bowls, and the cups with which to pour out; and the continual bread shall be on it.

title: Numbers 4:8
content: 8 They shall spread on them a scarlet cloth, and cover it with a covering of sealskin, and shall put in its poles.

title: Numbers 4:9
content: 9 “They shall take a blue cloth and cover the lamp stand of the light, its lamps, its snuffers, its snuff dishes, and all its oil vessels, with which they minister to it.

title: Numbers 4:10
content: 10 They shall put it and all its vessels within a covering of sealskin, and shall put it on the frame.

title: Numbers 4:11
content: 11 “On the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth, and cover it with a covering of sealskin, and shall put in its poles.

title: Numbers 4:12
content: 12 “They shall take all the vessels of ministry with which they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a covering of sealskin, and shall put them on the frame.

title: Numbers 4:13
content: 13 “They shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth on it.

title: Numbers 4:14
content: 14 They shall put on it all its vessels with which they minister about it, the fire pans, the meat hooks, the shovels, and the basins—all the vessels of the altar; and they shall spread on it a covering of sealskin, and put in its poles.

title: Numbers 4:15
content: 15 “When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furniture of the sanctuary, as the camp moves forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to carry it; but they shall not touch the sanctuary, lest they die. The sons of Kohath shall carry these things belonging to the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 4:16
content: 16 “The duty of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be the oil for the light, the sweet incense, the continual meal offering, and the anointing oil, the requirements of all the tabernacle, and of all that is in it, the sanctuary, and its furnishings.”

title: Numbers 4:17
content: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 4:18
content: 18 “Don’t cut off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites;

title: Numbers 4:19
content: 19 but do this to them, that they may live, and not die, when they approach the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint everyone to his service and to his burden;

title: Numbers 4:20
content: 20 but they shall not go in to see the sanctuary even for a moment, lest they die.”

title: Numbers 4:21
content: 21 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 4:22
content: 22 “Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers’ houses, by their families;

title: Numbers 4:23
content: 23 you shall count them from thirty years old and upward until fifty years old: all who enter in to wait on the service, to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 4:24
content: 24 “This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens:

title: Numbers 4:25
content: 25 they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the Tent of Meeting, its covering, the covering of sealskin that is on it, the screen for the door of the Tent of Meeting,

title: Numbers 4:26
content: 26 the hangings of the court, the screen for the door of the gate of the court which is by the tabernacle and around the altar, their cords, and all the instruments of their service, and whatever shall be done with them. They shall serve in there.

title: Numbers 4:27
content: 27 At the commandment of Aaron and his sons shall be all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all their burden and in all their service; and you shall appoint their duty to them in all their responsibilities.

title: Numbers 4:28
content: 28 This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting. Their duty shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers 4:29
content: 29 “As for the sons of Merari, you shall count them by their families, by their fathers’ houses;

title: Numbers 4:30
content: 30 you shall count them from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old—everyone who enters on the service, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 4:31
content: 31 This is the duty of their burden, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting: the tabernacle’s boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,

title: Numbers 4:32
content: 32 the pillars of the court around it, their sockets, their pins, their cords, with all their instruments, and with all their service. You shall appoint the instruments of the duty of their burden to them by name.

title: Numbers 4:33
content: 33 This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”

title: Numbers 4:34
content: 34 Moses and Aaron and the princes of the congregation counted the sons of the Kohathites by their families, and by their fathers’ houses,

title: Numbers 4:35
content: 35 from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 4:36
content: 36 Those who were counted of them by their families were two thousand seven hundred fifty.

title: Numbers 4:37
content: 37 These are those who were counted of the families of the Kohathites, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of the LORD by Moses.

title: Numbers 4:38
content: 38 Those who were counted of the sons of Gershon, by their families, and by their fathers’ houses,

title: Numbers 4:39
content: 39 from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old—everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,

title: Numbers 4:40
content: 40 even those who were counted of them, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, were two thousand six hundred thirty.

title: Numbers 4:41
content: 41 These are those who were counted of the families of the sons of Gershon, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of the LORD.

title: Numbers 4:42
content: 42 Those who were counted of the families of the sons of Merari, by their families, by their fathers’ houses,

title: Numbers 4:43
content: 43 from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old—everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,

title: Numbers 4:44
content: 44 even those who were counted of them by their families, were three thousand two hundred.

title: Numbers 4:45
content: 45 These are those who were counted of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of the LORD by Moses.

title: Numbers 4:46
content: 46 All those who were counted of the Levites whom Moses and Aaron and the princes of Israel counted, by their families and by their fathers’ houses,

title: Numbers 4:47
content: 47 from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered in to do the work of service and the work of bearing burdens in the Tent of Meeting,

title: Numbers 4:48
content: 48 even those who were counted of them, were eight thousand five hundred eighty.

title: Numbers 4:49
content: 49 According to the commandment of the LORD they were counted by Moses, everyone according to his service and according to his burden. Thus they were counted by him, as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 5:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 5:2
content: 2 “Command the children of Israel that they put out of the camp every leper, everyone who has a discharge, and whoever is unclean by a corpse.

title: Numbers 5:3
content: 3 You shall put both male and female outside of the camp so that they don’t defile their camp, in the midst of which I dwell.”

title: Numbers 5:4
content: 4 The children of Israel did so, and put them outside of the camp; as the LORD spoke to Moses, so the children of Israel did.

title: Numbers 5:5
content: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 5:6
content: 6 “Speak to the children of Israel: ‘When a man or woman commits any sin that men commit, so as to trespass against the LORD, and that soul is guilty,

title: Numbers 5:7
content: 7 then he shall confess his sin which he has done; and he shall make restitution for his guilt in full, add to it the fifth part of it, and give it to him in respect of whom he has been guilty.

title: Numbers 5:8
content: 8 But if the man has no kinsman to whom restitution may be made for the guilt, the restitution for guilt which is made to the LORD shall be the priest’s, in addition to the ram of the atonement, by which atonement shall be made for him.

title: Numbers 5:9
content: 9 Every heave offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they present to the priest, shall be his.

title: Numbers 5:10
content: 10 Every man’s holy things shall be his; whatever any man gives the priest, it shall be his.’”

title: Numbers 5:11
content: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 5:12
content: 12 “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,

title: Numbers 5:13
content: 13 and a man lies with her carnally, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband and this is kept concealed, and she is defiled, there is no witness against her, and she isn’t taken in the act;

title: Numbers 5:14
content: 14 and the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife and she is defiled; or if the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife and she isn’t defiled;

title: Numbers 5:15
content: 15 then the man shall bring his wife to the priest, and shall bring her offering for her: one tenth of an ephah of barley meal. He shall pour no oil on it, nor put frankincense on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of memorial, bringing iniquity to memory.

title: Numbers 5:16
content: 16 The priest shall bring her near, and set her before the LORD.

title: Numbers 5:17
content: 17 The priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel; and the priest shall take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.

title: Numbers 5:18
content: 18 The priest shall set the woman before the LORD, and let the hair of the woman’s head go loose, and put the meal offering of memorial in her hands, which is the meal offering of jealousy. The priest shall have in his hand the water of bitterness that brings a curse.

title: Numbers 5:19
content: 19 The priest shall cause her to take an oath and shall tell the woman, “If no man has lain with you, and if you haven’t gone aside to uncleanness, being under your husband’s authority, be free from this water of bitterness that brings a curse.

title: Numbers 5:20
content: 20 But if you have gone astray, being under your husband’s authority, and if you are defiled, and some man has lain with you besides your husband—”

title: Numbers 5:21
content: 21 then the priest shall cause the woman to swear with the oath of cursing, and the priest shall tell the woman, “May the LORD make you a curse and an oath among your people, when the LORD allows your thigh to fall away, and your body to swell;

title: Numbers 5:22
content: 22 and this water that brings a curse will go into your bowels, and make your body swell, and your thigh fall away.” The woman shall say, “Amen, Amen.”

title: Numbers 5:23
content: 23 “‘The priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall wipe them into the water of bitterness.

title: Numbers 5:24
content: 24 He shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that causes the curse; and the water that causes the curse shall enter into her and become bitter.

title: Numbers 5:25
content: 25 The priest shall take the meal offering of jealousy out of the woman’s hand, and shall wave the meal offering before the LORD, and bring it to the altar.

title: Numbers 5:26
content: 26 The priest shall take a handful of the meal offering, as its memorial portion, and burn it on the altar, and afterward shall make the woman drink the water.

title: Numbers 5:27
content: 27 When he has made her drink the water, then it shall happen, if she is defiled and has committed a trespass against her husband, that the water that causes the curse will enter into her and become bitter, and her body will swell, and her thigh will fall away; and the woman will be a curse among her people.

title: Numbers 5:28
content: 28 If the woman isn’t defiled, but is clean; then she shall be free, and shall conceive offspring.

title: Numbers 5:29
content: 29 “‘This is the law of jealousy, when a wife, being under her husband, goes astray, and is defiled,

title: Numbers 5:30
content: 30 or when the spirit of jealousy comes on a man, and he is jealous of his wife; then he shall set the woman before the LORD, and the priest shall execute on her all this law.

title: Numbers 5:31
content: 31 The man shall be free from iniquity, and that woman shall bear her iniquity.’”

title: Numbers 6:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 6:2
content: 2 “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: ‘When either man or woman shall make a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to the LORD,

title: Numbers 6:3
content: 3 he shall separate himself from wine and strong drink. He shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of fermented drink, neither shall he drink any juice of grapes, nor eat fresh grapes or dried.

title: Numbers 6:4
content: 4 All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is made of the grapevine, from the seeds even to the skins.

title: Numbers 6:5
content: 5 “‘All the days of his vow of separation no razor shall come on his head, until the days are fulfilled in which he separates himself to the LORD. He shall be holy. He shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long.

title: Numbers 6:6
content: 6 “‘All the days that he separates himself to the LORD he shall not go near a dead body.

title: Numbers 6:7
content: 7 He shall not make himself unclean for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, when they die, because his separation to God is on his head.

title: Numbers 6:8
content: 8 All the days of his separation he is holy to the LORD.

title: Numbers 6:9
content: 9 “‘If any man dies very suddenly beside him, and he defiles the head of his separation, then he shall shave his head in the day of his cleansing. On the seventh day he shall shave it.

title: Numbers 6:10
content: 10 On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 6:11
content: 11 The priest shall offer one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned by reason of the dead, and shall make his head holy that same day.

title: Numbers 6:12
content: 12 He shall separate to the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a male lamb a year old for a trespass offering; but the former days shall be void, because his separation was defiled.

title: Numbers 6:13
content: 13 “‘This is the law of the Nazirite: when the days of his separation are fulfilled, he shall be brought to the door of the Tent of Meeting,

title: Numbers 6:14
content: 14 and he shall offer his offering to the LORD: one male lamb a year old without defect for a burnt offering, one ewe lamb a year old without defect for a sin offering, one ram without defect for peace offerings,

title: Numbers 6:15
content: 15 a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil with their meal offering and their drink offerings.

title: Numbers 6:16
content: 16 The priest shall present them before the LORD, and shall offer his sin offering and his burnt offering.

title: Numbers 6:17
content: 17 He shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to the LORD, with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest shall offer also its meal offering and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 6:18
content: 18 The Nazirite shall shave the head of his separation at the door of the Tent of Meeting, take the hair of the head of his separation, and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.

title: Numbers 6:19
content: 19 The priest shall take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them on the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved the head of his separation;

title: Numbers 6:20
content: 20 and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the LORD. They are holy for the priest, together with the breast that is waved and the thigh that is offered. After that the Nazirite may drink wine.

title: Numbers 6:21
content: 21 “‘This is the law of the Nazirite who vows and of his offering to the LORD for his separation, in addition to that which he is able to afford. According to his vow which he vows, so he must do after the law of his separation.’”

title: Numbers 6:22
content: 22 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 6:23
content: 23 “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, ‘This is how you shall bless the children of Israel.’ You shall tell them,

title: Numbers 6:24
content: 24 ‘The LORD bless you, and keep you.

title: Numbers 6:25
content: 25 The LORD make his face to shine on you, and be gracious to you.

title: Numbers 6:26
content: 26 The LORD lift up his face toward you, and give you peace.’

title: Numbers 6:27
content: 27 “So they shall put my name on the children of Israel; and I will bless them.”

title: Numbers 7:1
content: 1 On the day that Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, and had anointed it and sanctified it with all its furniture, and the altar with all its vessels, and had anointed and sanctified them;

title: Numbers 7:2
content: 2 the princes of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ houses, gave offerings. These were the princes of the tribes. These are they who were over those who were counted;

title: Numbers 7:3
content: 3 and they brought their offering before the LORD, six covered wagons and twelve oxen; a wagon for every two of the princes, and for each one an ox. They presented them before the tabernacle.

title: Numbers 7:4
content: 4 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 7:5
content: 5 “Accept these from them, that they may be used in doing the service of the Tent of Meeting; and you shall give them to the Levites, to every man according to his service.”

title: Numbers 7:6
content: 6 Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and gave them to the Levites.

title: Numbers 7:7
content: 7 He gave two wagons and four oxen to the sons of Gershon, according to their service.

title: Numbers 7:8
content: 8 He gave four wagons and eight oxen to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers 7:9
content: 9 But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because the service of the sanctuary belonged to them; they carried it on their shoulders.

title: Numbers 7:10
content: 10 The princes gave offerings for the dedication of the altar in the day that it was anointed. The princes gave their offerings before the altar.

title: Numbers 7:11
content: 11 The LORD said to Moses, “They shall offer their offering, each prince on his day, for the dedication of the altar.”

title: Numbers 7:12
content: 12 He who offered his offering the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah,

title: Numbers 7:13
content: 13 and his offering was: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:14
content: 14 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:15
content: 15 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:16
content: 16 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:17
content: 17 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

title: Numbers 7:18
content: 18 On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, prince of Issachar, gave his offering.

title: Numbers 7:19
content: 19 He offered for his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:20
content: 20 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:21
content: 21 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:22
content: 22 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:23
content: 23 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.

title: Numbers 7:24
content: 24 On the third day Eliab the son of Helon, prince of the children of Zebulun,

title: Numbers 7:25
content: 25 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:26
content: 26 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:27
content: 27 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:28
content: 28 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:29
content: 29 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.

title: Numbers 7:30
content: 30 On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, prince of the children of Reuben,

title: Numbers 7:31
content: 31 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:32
content: 32 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:33
content: 33 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:34
content: 34 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:35
content: 35 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.

title: Numbers 7:36
content: 36 On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, prince of the children of Simeon,

title: Numbers 7:37
content: 37 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:38
content: 38 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:39
content: 39 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:40
content: 40 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:41
content: 41 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old: this was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

title: Numbers 7:42
content: 42 On the sixth day, Eliasaph the son of Deuel, prince of the children of Gad,

title: Numbers 7:43
content: 43 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:44
content: 44 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:45
content: 45 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:46
content: 46 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:47
content: 47 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

title: Numbers 7:48
content: 48 On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, prince of the children of Ephraim,

title: Numbers 7:49
content: 49 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:50
content: 50 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:51
content: 51 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:52
content: 52 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:53
content: 53 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers 7:54
content: 54 On the eighth day Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, prince of the children of Manasseh,

title: Numbers 7:55
content: 55 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:56
content: 56 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:57
content: 57 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:58
content: 58 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:59
content: 59 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

title: Numbers 7:60
content: 60 On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, prince of the children of Benjamin,

title: Numbers 7:61
content: 61 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:62
content: 62 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:63
content: 63 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:64
content: 64 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:65
content: 65 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.

title: Numbers 7:66
content: 66 On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan,

title: Numbers 7:67
content: 67 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:68
content: 68 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:69
content: 69 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:70
content: 70 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:71
content: 71 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers 7:72
content: 72 On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ochran, prince of the children of Asher,

title: Numbers 7:73
content: 73 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:74
content: 74 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:75
content: 75 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:76
content: 76 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:77
content: 77 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ochran.

title: Numbers 7:78
content: 78 On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali,

title: Numbers 7:79
content: 79 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers 7:80
content: 80 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

title: Numbers 7:81
content: 81 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

title: Numbers 7:82
content: 82 one male goat for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:83
content: 83 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.

title: Numbers 7:84
content: 84 This was the dedication offering of the altar, on the day when it was anointed, by the princes of Israel: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, twelve golden ladles;

title: Numbers 7:85
content: 85 each silver platter weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the vessels two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary;

title: Numbers 7:86
content: 86 the twelve golden ladles, full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, according to the shekel of the sanctuary; all the gold of the ladles weighed one hundred twenty shekels;

title: Numbers 7:87
content: 87 all the cattle for the burnt offering twelve bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs a year old twelve, and their meal offering; and twelve male goats for a sin offering;

title: Numbers 7:88
content: 88 and all the cattle for the sacrifice of peace offerings: twenty-four bulls, sixty rams, sixty male goats, and sixty male lambs a year old. This was the dedication offering of the altar, after it was anointed.

title: Numbers 7:89
content: 89 When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with the LORD, he heard his voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim; and he spoke to him.

title: Numbers 8:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 8:2
content: 2 “Speak to Aaron, and tell him, ‘When you light the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lamp stand.’”

title: Numbers 8:3
content: 3 Aaron did so. He lit its lamps to light the area in front of the lamp stand, as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 8:4
content: 4 This was the workmanship of the lamp stand, beaten work of gold. From its base to its flowers, it was beaten work. He made the lamp stand according to the pattern which the LORD had shown Moses.

title: Numbers 8:5
content: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 8:6
content: 6 “Take the Levites from among the children of Israel, and cleanse them.

title: Numbers 8:7
content: 7 You shall do this to them to cleanse them: sprinkle the water of cleansing on them, let them shave their whole bodies with a razor, let them wash their clothes, and cleanse themselves.

title: Numbers 8:8
content: 8 Then let them take a young bull and its meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil; and another young bull you shall take for a sin offering.

title: Numbers 8:9
content: 9 You shall present the Levites before the Tent of Meeting. You shall assemble the whole congregation of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 8:10
content: 10 You shall present the Levites before the LORD. The children of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites,

title: Numbers 8:11
content: 11 and Aaron shall offer the Levites before the LORD for a wave offering on the behalf of the children of Israel, that it may be theirs to do the service of the LORD.

title: Numbers 8:12
content: 12 “The Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and you shall offer the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering to the LORD, to make atonement for the Levites.

title: Numbers 8:13
content: 13 You shall set the Levites before Aaron and before his sons, and offer them as a wave offering to the LORD.

title: Numbers 8:14
content: 14 Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the children of Israel, and the Levites shall be mine.

title: Numbers 8:15
content: 15 “After that, the Levites shall go in to do the service of the Tent of Meeting. You shall cleanse them, and offer them as a wave offering.

title: Numbers 8:16
content: 16 For they are wholly given to me from among the children of Israel; instead of all who open the womb, even the firstborn of all the children of Israel, I have taken them to me.

title: Numbers 8:17
content: 17 For all the firstborn among the children of Israel are mine, both man and animal. On the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for myself.

title: Numbers 8:18
content: 18 I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 8:19
content: 19 I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the Tent of Meeting, and to make atonement for the children of Israel, so that there will be no plague among the children of Israel when the children of Israel come near to the sanctuary.”

title: Numbers 8:20
content: 20 Moses, and Aaron, and all the congregation of the children of Israel did so to the Levites. According to all that the LORD commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them.

title: Numbers 8:21
content: 21 The Levites purified themselves from sin, and they washed their clothes; and Aaron offered them for a wave offering before the LORD and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them.

title: Numbers 8:22
content: 22 After that, the Levites went in to do their service in the Tent of Meeting before Aaron and before his sons: as the LORD had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.

title: Numbers 8:23
content: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 8:24
content: 24 “This is what is assigned to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall go in to wait on the service in the work of the Tent of Meeting;

title: Numbers 8:25
content: 25 and from the age of fifty years they shall retire from doing the work, and shall serve no more,

title: Numbers 8:26
content: 26 but shall assist their brothers in the Tent of Meeting, to perform the duty, and shall perform no service. This is how you shall have the Levites do their duties.”

title: Numbers 9:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

title: Numbers 9:2
content: 2 “Let the children of Israel keep the Passover in its appointed season.

title: Numbers 9:3
content: 3 On the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you shall keep it in its appointed season. You shall keep it according to all its statutes and according to all its ordinances.”

title: Numbers 9:4
content: 4 Moses told the children of Israel that they should keep the Passover.

title: Numbers 9:5
content: 5 They kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, in the wilderness of Sinai. According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did.

title: Numbers 9:6
content: 6 There were certain men who were unclean because of the dead body of a man, so that they could not keep the Passover on that day, and they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.

title: Numbers 9:7
content: 7 Those men said to him, “We are unclean because of the dead body of a man. Why are we kept back, that we may not offer the offering of the LORD in its appointed season among the children of Israel?”

title: Numbers 9:8
content: 8 Moses answered them, “Wait, that I may hear what the LORD will command concerning you.”

title: Numbers 9:9
content: 9 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 9:10
content: 10 “Say to the children of Israel, ‘If any man of you or of your generations is unclean by reason of a dead body, or is on a journey far away, he shall still keep the Passover to the LORD.

title: Numbers 9:11
content: 11 In the second month, on the fourteenth day at evening they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

title: Numbers 9:12
content: 12 They shall leave none of it until the morning, nor break a bone of it. According to all the statute of the Passover they shall keep it.

title: Numbers 9:13
content: 13 But the man who is clean, and is not on a journey, and fails to keep the Passover, that soul shall be cut off from his people. Because he didn’t offer the offering of the LORD in its appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.

title: Numbers 9:14
content: 14 “‘If a foreigner lives among you and desires to keep the Passover to the LORD, then he shall do so according to the statute of the Passover, and according to its ordinance. You shall have one statute, both for the foreigner and for him who is born in the land.’”

title: Numbers 9:15
content: 15 On the day that the tabernacle was raised up, the cloud covered the tabernacle, even the Tent of the Testimony. At evening it was over the tabernacle, as it were the appearance of fire, until morning.

title: Numbers 9:16
content: 16 So it was continually. The cloud covered it, and the appearance of fire by night.

title: Numbers 9:17
content: 17 Whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Tent, then after that the children of Israel traveled; and in the place where the cloud remained, there the children of Israel encamped.

title: Numbers 9:18
content: 18 At the commandment of the LORD, the children of Israel traveled, and at the commandment of the LORD they encamped. As long as the cloud remained on the tabernacle they remained encamped.

title: Numbers 9:19
content: 19 When the cloud stayed on the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept the LORD’s command, and didn’t travel.

title: Numbers 9:20
content: 20 Sometimes the cloud was a few days on the tabernacle; then according to the commandment of the LORD they remained encamped, and according to the commandment of the LORD they traveled.

title: Numbers 9:21
content: 21 Sometimes the cloud was from evening until morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning, they traveled; or by day and by night, when the cloud was taken up, they traveled.

title: Numbers 9:22
content: 22 Whether it was two days, or a month, or a year that the cloud stayed on the tabernacle, remaining on it, the children of Israel remained encamped, and didn’t travel; but when it was taken up, they traveled.

title: Numbers 9:23
content: 23 At the commandment of the LORD they encamped, and at the commandment of the LORD they traveled. They kept the LORD’s command, at the commandment of the LORD by Moses.

title: Numbers 10:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 10:2
content: 2 “Make two trumpets of silver. You shall make them of beaten work. You shall use them for the calling of the congregation and for the journeying of the camps.

title: Numbers 10:3
content: 3 When they blow them, all the congregation shall gather themselves to you at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

title: Numbers 10:4
content: 4 If they blow just one, then the princes, the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall gather themselves to you.

title: Numbers 10:5
content: 5 When you blow an alarm, the camps that lie on the east side shall go forward.

title: Numbers 10:6
content: 6 When you blow an alarm the second time, the camps that lie on the south side shall go forward. They shall blow an alarm for their journeys.

title: Numbers 10:7
content: 7 But when the assembly is to be gathered together, you shall blow, but you shall not sound an alarm.

title: Numbers 10:8
content: 8 “The sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets. This shall be to you for a statute forever throughout your generations.

title: Numbers 10:9
content: 9 When you go to war in your land against the adversary who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets. Then you will be remembered before the LORD your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.

title: Numbers 10:10
content: 10 “Also in the day of your gladness, and in your set feasts, and in the beginnings of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; and they shall be to you for a memorial before your God. I am the LORD your God.”

title: Numbers 10:11
content: 11 In the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle of the covenant.

title: Numbers 10:12
content: 12 The children of Israel went forward on their journeys out of the wilderness of Sinai; and the cloud stayed in the wilderness of Paran.

title: Numbers 10:13
content: 13 They first went forward according to the commandment of the LORD by Moses.

title: Numbers 10:14
content: 14 First, the standard of the camp of the children of Judah went forward according to their armies. Nahshon the son of Amminadab was over his army.

title: Numbers 10:15
content: 15 Nethanel the son of Zuar was over the army of the tribe of the children of Issachar.

title: Numbers 10:16
content: 16 Eliab the son of Helon was over the army of the tribe of the children of Zebulun.

title: Numbers 10:17
content: 17 The tabernacle was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who bore the tabernacle, went forward.

title: Numbers 10:18
content: 18 The standard of the camp of Reuben went forward according to their armies. Elizur the son of Shedeur was over his army.

title: Numbers 10:19
content: 19 Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai was over the army of the tribe of the children of Simeon.

title: Numbers 10:20
content: 20 Eliasaph the son of Deuel was over the army of the tribe of the children of Gad.

title: Numbers 10:21
content: 21 The Kohathites set forward, bearing the sanctuary. The others set up the tabernacle before they arrived.

title: Numbers 10:22
content: 22 The standard of the camp of the children of Ephraim set forward according to their armies. Elishama the son of Ammihud was over his army.

title: Numbers 10:23
content: 23 Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur was over the army of the tribe of the children of Manasseh.

title: Numbers 10:24
content: 24 Abidan the son of Gideoni was over the army of the tribe of the children of Benjamin.

title: Numbers 10:25
content: 25 The standard of the camp of the children of Dan, which was the rear guard of all the camps, set forward according to their armies. Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai was over his army.

title: Numbers 10:26
content: 26 Pagiel the son of Ochran was over the army of the tribe of the children of Asher.

title: Numbers 10:27
content: 27 Ahira the son of Enan was over the army of the tribe of the children of Naphtali.

title: Numbers 10:28
content: 28 Thus were the travels of the children of Israel according to their armies; and they went forward.

title: Numbers 10:29
content: 29 Moses said to Hobab, the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are journeying to the place of which the LORD said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us, and we will treat you well; for the LORD has spoken good concerning Israel.”

title: Numbers 10:30
content: 30 He said to him, “I will not go; but I will depart to my own land, and to my relatives.”

title: Numbers 10:31
content: 31 Moses said, “Don’t leave us, please; because you know how we are to encamp in the wilderness, and you can be our eyes.

title: Numbers 10:32
content: 32 It shall be, if you go with us—yes, it shall be—that whatever good the LORD does to us, we will do the same to you.”

title: Numbers 10:33
content: 33 They set forward from the Mount of the LORD three days’ journey. The ark of the LORD’s covenant went before them three days’ journey, to seek out a resting place for them.

title: Numbers 10:34
content: 34 The cloud of the LORD was over them by day, when they set forward from the camp.

title: Numbers 10:35
content: 35 When the ark went forward, Moses said, “Rise up, LORD, and let your enemies be scattered! Let those who hate you flee before you!”

title: Numbers 10:36
content: 36 When it rested, he said, “Return, LORD, to the ten thousands of the thousands of Israel.”

title: Numbers 11:1
content: 1 The people were complaining in the ears of the LORD. When the LORD heard it, his anger burned; and the LORD’s fire burned among them, and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.

title: Numbers 11:2
content: 2 The people cried to Moses; and Moses prayed to the LORD, and the fire abated.

title: Numbers 11:3
content: 3 The name of that place was called Taberah, because the LORD’s fire burned among them.

title: Numbers 11:4
content: 4 The mixed multitude that was among them lusted exceedingly; and the children of Israel also wept again, and said, “Who will give us meat to eat?

title: Numbers 11:5
content: 5 We remember the fish, which we ate in Egypt for nothing; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlic;

title: Numbers 11:6
content: 6 but now we have lost our appetite. There is nothing at all except this manna to look at.”

title: Numbers 11:7
content: 7 The manna was like coriander seed, and it looked like bdellium.

title: Numbers 11:8
content: 8 The people went around, gathered it, and ground it in mills, or beat it in mortars, and boiled it in pots, and made cakes of it. Its taste was like the taste of fresh oil.

title: Numbers 11:9
content: 9 When the dew fell on the camp in the night, the manna fell on it.

title: Numbers 11:10
content: 10 Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, every man at the door of his tent; and the LORD’s anger burned greatly; and Moses was displeased.

title: Numbers 11:11
content: 11 Moses said to the LORD, “Why have you treated your servant so badly? Why haven’t I found favor in your sight, that you lay the burden of all this people on me?

title: Numbers 11:12
content: 12 Have I conceived all this people? Have I brought them out, that you should tell me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries a nursing infant, to the land which you swore to their fathers’?

title: Numbers 11:13
content: 13 Where could I get meat to give all these people? For they weep before me, saying, ‘Give us meat, that we may eat.’

title: Numbers 11:14
content: 14 I am not able to bear all this people alone, because it is too heavy for me.

title: Numbers 11:15
content: 15 If you treat me this way, please kill me right now, if I have found favor in your sight; and don’t let me see my wretchedness.”

title: Numbers 11:16
content: 16 The LORD said to Moses, “Gather to me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people and officers over them; and bring them to the Tent of Meeting, that they may stand there with you.

title: Numbers 11:17
content: 17 I will come down and talk with you there. I will take of the Spirit which is on you, and will put it on them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, that you don’t bear it yourself alone.

title: Numbers 11:18
content: 18 “Say to the people, ‘Sanctify yourselves in preparation for tomorrow, and you will eat meat; for you have wept in the ears of the LORD, saying, “Who will give us meat to eat? For it was well with us in Egypt.” Therefore the LORD will give you meat, and you will eat.

title: Numbers 11:19
content: 19 You will not eat just one day, or two days, or five days, or ten days, or twenty days,

title: Numbers 11:20
content: 20 but a whole month, until it comes out at your nostrils, and it is loathsome to you; because you have rejected the LORD who is among you, and have wept before him, saying, “Why did we come out of Egypt?”’”

title: Numbers 11:21
content: 21 Moses said, “The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand men on foot; and you have said, ‘I will give them meat, that they may eat a whole month.’

title: Numbers 11:22
content: 22 Shall flocks and herds be slaughtered for them, to be sufficient for them? Shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to be sufficient for them?”

title: Numbers 11:23
content: 23 The LORD said to Moses, “Has the LORD’s hand grown short? Now you will see whether my word will happen to you or not.”

title: Numbers 11:24
content: 24 Moses went out, and told the people the LORD’s words; and he gathered seventy men of the elders of the people, and set them around the Tent.

title: Numbers 11:25
content: 25 The LORD came down in the cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was on him, and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did so no more.

title: Numbers 11:26
content: 26 But two men remained in the camp. The name of one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad; and the Spirit rested on them. They were of those who were written, but had not gone out to the Tent; and they prophesied in the camp.

title: Numbers 11:27
content: 27 A young man ran, and told Moses, and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”

title: Numbers 11:28
content: 28 Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his chosen men, answered, “My lord Moses, forbid them!”

title: Numbers 11:29
content: 29 Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all the LORD’s people were prophets, that the LORD would put his Spirit on them!”

title: Numbers 11:30
content: 30 Moses went into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

title: Numbers 11:31
content: 31 A wind from the LORD went out and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, about a day’s journey on this side, and a day’s journey on the other side, around the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the earth.

title: Numbers 11:32
content: 32 The people rose up all that day, and all of that night, and all the next day, and gathered the quails. He who gathered least gathered ten homers; and they spread them all out for themselves around the camp.

title: Numbers 11:33
content: 33 While the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the LORD’s anger burned against the people, and the LORD struck the people with a very great plague.

title: Numbers 11:34
content: 34 The name of that place was called Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who lusted.

title: Numbers 11:35
content: 35 From Kibroth Hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth; and they stayed at Hazeroth.

title: Numbers 12:1
content: 1 Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married; for he had married a Cushite woman.

title: Numbers 12:2
content: 2 They said, “Has the LORD indeed spoken only with Moses? Hasn’t he spoken also with us?” And the LORD heard it.

title: Numbers 12:3
content: 3 Now the man Moses was very humble, more than all the men who were on the surface of the earth.

title: Numbers 12:4
content: 4 The LORD spoke suddenly to Moses, to Aaron, and to Miriam, “You three come out to the Tent of Meeting!” The three of them came out.

title: Numbers 12:5
content: 5 The LORD came down in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the door of the Tent, and called Aaron and Miriam; and they both came forward.

title: Numbers 12:6
content: 6 He said, “Now hear my words. If there is a prophet among you, I, the LORD, will make myself known to him in a vision. I will speak with him in a dream.

title: Numbers 12:7
content: 7 My servant Moses is not so. He is faithful in all my house.

title: Numbers 12:8
content: 8 With him, I will speak mouth to mouth, even plainly, and not in riddles; and he shall see the LORD’s form. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?”

title: Numbers 12:9
content: 9 The LORD’s anger burned against them; and he departed.

title: Numbers 12:10
content: 10 The cloud departed from over the Tent; and behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. Aaron looked at Miriam, and behold, she was leprous.

title: Numbers 12:11
content: 11 Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord, please don’t count this sin against us, in which we have done foolishly, and in which we have sinned.

title: Numbers 12:12
content: 12 Let her not, I pray, be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother’s womb.”

title: Numbers 12:13
content: 13 Moses cried to the LORD, saying, “Heal her, God, I beg you!”

title: Numbers 12:14
content: 14 The LORD said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, shouldn’t she be ashamed seven days? Let her be shut up outside of the camp seven days, and after that she shall be brought in again.”

title: Numbers 12:15
content: 15 Miriam was shut up outside of the camp seven days, and the people didn’t travel until Miriam was brought in again.

title: Numbers 12:16
content: 16 Afterward the people traveled from Hazeroth, and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.

title: Numbers 13:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 13:2
content: 2 “Send men, that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel. Of every tribe of their fathers, you shall send a man, every one a prince among them.”

title: Numbers 13:3
content: 3 Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran according to the commandment of the LORD. All of them were men who were heads of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 13:4
content: 4 These were their names: Of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur.

title: Numbers 13:5
content: 5 Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori.

title: Numbers 13:6
content: 6 Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

title: Numbers 13:7
content: 7 Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph.

title: Numbers 13:8
content: 8 Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun.

title: Numbers 13:9
content: 9 Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu.

title: Numbers 13:10
content: 10 Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi.

title: Numbers 13:11
content: 11 Of the tribe of Joseph, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi.

title: Numbers 13:12
content: 12 Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli.

title: Numbers 13:13
content: 13 Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael.

title: Numbers 13:14
content: 14 Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi.

title: Numbers 13:15
content: 15 Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.

title: Numbers 13:16
content: 16 These are the names of the men who Moses sent to spy out the land. Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun Joshua.

title: Numbers 13:17
content: 17 Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, “Go up this way by the South, and go up into the hill country.

title: Numbers 13:18
content: 18 See the land, what it is; and the people who dwell therein, whether they are strong or weak, whether they are few or many;

title: Numbers 13:19
content: 19 and what the land is that they dwell in, whether it is good or bad; and what cities they are that they dwell in, whether in camps, or in strongholds;

title: Numbers 13:20
content: 20 and what the land is, whether it is fertile or poor, whether there is wood therein, or not. Be courageous, and bring some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the time of the first-ripe grapes.

title: Numbers 13:21
content: 21 So they went up, and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, to the entrance of Hamath.

title: Numbers 13:22
content: 22 They went up by the South, and came to Hebron; and Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were there. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

title: Numbers 13:23
content: 23 They came to the valley of Eshcol, and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bore it on a staff between two. They also brought some of the pomegranates and figs.
