content: 21 He shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before the LORD. At his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.”

title: Numbers 27:22
content: 22 Moses did as the LORD commanded him. He took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation.

title: Numbers 27:23
content: 23 He laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as the LORD spoke by Moses.

title: Numbers 28:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 28:2
content: 2 “Command the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘See that you present my offering, my food for my offerings made by fire, as a pleasant aroma to me, in their due season.’

title: Numbers 28:3
content: 3 You shall tell them, ‘This is the offering made by fire which you shall offer to the LORD: male lambs a year old without defect, two day by day, for a continual burnt offering.

title: Numbers 28:4
content: 4 You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at evening,

title: Numbers 28:5
content: 5 with one tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil.

title: Numbers 28:6
content: 6 It is a continual burnt offering which was ordained in Mount Sinai for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.

title: Numbers 28:7
content: 7 Its drink offering shall be the fourth part of a hin for each lamb. You shall pour out a drink offering of strong drink to the LORD in the holy place.

title: Numbers 28:8
content: 8 The other lamb you shall offer at evening. As the meal offering of the morning, and as its drink offering, you shall offer it, an offering made by fire, for a pleasant aroma to the LORD.

title: Numbers 28:9
content: 9 “‘On the Sabbath day, you shall offer two male lambs a year old without defect, and two tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering mixed with oil, and its drink offering:

title: Numbers 28:10
content: 10 this is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 28:11
content: 11 “‘In the beginnings of your months, you shall offer a burnt offering to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without defect,

title: Numbers 28:12
content: 12 and three tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering mixed with oil, for each bull; and two tenth parts of fine flour for a meal offering mixed with oil, for the one ram;

title: Numbers 28:13
content: 13 and one tenth part of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering to every lamb, as a burnt offering of a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.

title: Numbers 28:14
content: 14 Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, the third part of a hin for the ram, and the fourth part of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.

title: Numbers 28:15
content: 15 Also, one male goat for a sin offering to the LORD shall be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 28:16
content: 16 “‘In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, is the LORD’s Passover.

title: Numbers 28:17
content: 17 On the fifteenth day of this month shall be a feast. Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.

title: Numbers 28:18
content: 18 In the first day shall be a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work,

title: Numbers 28:19
content: 19 but you shall offer an offering made by fire, a burnt offering to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old. They shall be without defect,

title: Numbers 28:20
content: 20 with their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil. You shall offer three tenths for a bull, and two tenths for the ram.

title: Numbers 28:21
content: 21 You shall offer one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers 28:22
content: 22 and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you.

title: Numbers 28:23
content: 23 You shall offer these in addition to the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.

title: Numbers 28:24
content: 24 In this way you shall offer daily, for seven days, the food of the offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to the LORD. It shall be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 28:25
content: 25 On the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work.

title: Numbers 28:26
content: 26 “‘Also in the day of the first fruits, when you offer a new meal offering to the LORD in your feast of weeks, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work;

title: Numbers 28:27
content: 27 but you shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old;

title: Numbers 28:28
content: 28 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths for each bull, two tenths for the one ram,

title: Numbers 28:29
content: 29 one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers 28:30
content: 30 and one male goat, to make atonement for you.

title: Numbers 28:31
content: 31 Besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering, you shall offer them and their drink offerings. See that they are without defect.

title: Numbers 29:1
content: 1 “‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no regular work. It is a day of blowing of trumpets to you.

title: Numbers 29:2
content: 2 You shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to the LORD: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:3
content: 3 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil: three tenths for the bull, two tenths for the ram,

title: Numbers 29:4
content: 4 and one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers 29:5
content: 5 and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you;

title: Numbers 29:6
content: 6 in addition to the burnt offering of the new moon with its meal offering, and the continual burnt offering with its meal offering, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.

title: Numbers 29:7
content: 7 “‘On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall afflict your souls. You shall do no kind of work;

title: Numbers 29:8
content: 8 but you shall offer a burnt offering to the LORD for a pleasant aroma: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old, all without defect;

title: Numbers 29:9
content: 9 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil: three tenths for the bull, two tenths for the one ram,

title: Numbers 29:10
content: 10 one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers 29:11
content: 11 one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering of atonement, and the continual burnt offering, and its meal offering, and their drink offerings.

title: Numbers 29:12
content: 12 “‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work. You shall keep a feast to the LORD seven days.

title: Numbers 29:13
content: 13 You shall offer a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to the LORD: thirteen young bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect;

title: Numbers 29:14
content: 14 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil: three tenths for every bull of the thirteen bulls, two tenths for each ram of the two rams,

title: Numbers 29:15
content: 15 and one tenth for every lamb of the fourteen lambs;

title: Numbers 29:16
content: 16 and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 29:17
content: 17 “‘On the second day you shall offer twelve young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:18
content: 18 and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

title: Numbers 29:19
content: 19 and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, with its meal offering and their drink offerings.

title: Numbers 29:20
content: 20 “‘On the third day: eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:21
content: 21 and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

title: Numbers 29:22
content: 22 and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 29:23
content: 23 “‘On the fourth day ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:24
content: 24 their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

title: Numbers 29:25
content: 25 and one male goat for a sin offering; in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 29:26
content: 26 “‘On the fifth day: nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:27
content: 27 and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance,

title: Numbers 29:28
content: 28 and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 29:29
content: 29 “‘On the sixth day: eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:30
content: 30 and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance,

title: Numbers 29:31
content: 31 and one male goat for a sin offering; in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and the drink offerings of it.

title: Numbers 29:32
content: 32 “‘On the seventh day: seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:33
content: 33 and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance,

title: Numbers 29:34
content: 34 and one male goat for a sin offering; in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 29:35
content: 35 “‘On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly. You shall do no regular work;

title: Numbers 29:36
content: 36 but you shall offer a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, a pleasant aroma to the LORD: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without defect;

title: Numbers 29:37
content: 37 their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the ordinance,

title: Numbers 29:38
content: 38 and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, with its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers 29:39
content: 39 “‘You shall offer these to the LORD in your set feasts—in addition to your vows and your free will offerings—for your burnt offerings, your meal offerings, your drink offerings, and your peace offerings.’”

title: Numbers 29:40
content: 40 Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 30:1
content: 1 Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying, “This is the thing which the LORD has commanded.

title: Numbers 30:2
content: 2 When a man vows a vow to the LORD, or swears an oath to bind his soul with a bond, he shall not break his word. He shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.

title: Numbers 30:3
content: 3 “Also, when a woman vows a vow to the LORD and binds herself by a pledge, being in her father’s house, in her youth,

title: Numbers 30:4
content: 4 and her father hears her vow and her pledge with which she has bound her soul, and her father says nothing to her, then all her vows shall stand, and every pledge with which she has bound her soul shall stand.

title: Numbers 30:5
content: 5 But if her father forbids her in the day that he hears, none of her vows or of her pledges with which she has bound her soul, shall stand. The LORD will forgive her, because her father has forbidden her.

title: Numbers 30:6
content: 6 “If she has a husband, while her vows are on her, or the rash utterance of her lips with which she has bound her soul,

title: Numbers 30:7
content: 7 and her husband hears it, and says nothing to her in the day that he hears it; then her vows shall stand, and her pledges with which she has bound her soul shall stand.

title: Numbers 30:8
content: 8 But if her husband forbids her in the day that he hears it, then he makes void her vow which is on her and the rash utterance of her lips, with which she has bound her soul. The LORD will forgive her.

title: Numbers 30:9
content: 9 “But the vow of a widow, or of her who is divorced, everything with which she has bound her soul shall stand against her.

title: Numbers 30:10
content: 10 “If she vowed in her husband’s house or bound her soul by a bond with an oath,

title: Numbers 30:11
content: 11 and her husband heard it, and held his peace at her and didn’t disallow her, then all her vows shall stand, and every pledge with which she bound her soul shall stand.

title: Numbers 30:12
content: 12 But if her husband made them null and void in the day that he heard them, then whatever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand. Her husband has made them void. The LORD will forgive her.

title: Numbers 30:13
content: 13 Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.

title: Numbers 30:14
content: 14 But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day, then he establishes all her vows or all her pledges which are on her. He has established them, because he said nothing to her in the day that he heard them.

title: Numbers 30:15
content: 15 But if he makes them null and void after he has heard them, then he shall bear her iniquity.”

title: Numbers 30:16
content: 16 These are the statutes which the LORD commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, between a father and his daughter, being in her youth, in her father’s house.

title: Numbers 31:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 31:2
content: 2 “Avenge the children of Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you shall be gathered to your people.”

title: Numbers 31:3
content: 3 Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm men from among you for war, that they may go against Midian, to execute the LORD’s vengeance on Midian.

title: Numbers 31:4
content: 4 You shall send one thousand out of every tribe, throughout all the tribes of Israel, to the war.”

title: Numbers 31:5
content: 5 So there were delivered, out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand from every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.

title: Numbers 31:6
content: 6 Moses sent them, one thousand of every tribe, to the war with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.

title: Numbers 31:7
content: 7 They fought against Midian, as the LORD commanded Moses. They killed every male.

title: Numbers 31:8
content: 8 They killed the kings of Midian with the rest of their slain: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.

title: Numbers 31:9
content: 9 The children of Israel took the women of Midian captive with their little ones; and all their livestock, all their flocks, and all their goods, they took as plunder.

title: Numbers 31:10
content: 10 All their cities in the places in which they lived, and all their encampments, they burned with fire.

title: Numbers 31:11
content: 11 They took all the captives, and all the plunder, both of man and of animal.

title: Numbers 31:12
content: 12 They brought the captives with the prey and the plunder, to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of the children of Israel, to the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by the Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers 31:13
content: 13 Moses and Eleazar the priest, with all the princes of the congregation, went out to meet them outside of the camp.

title: Numbers 31:14
content: 14 Moses was angry with the officers of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who came from the service of the war.

title: Numbers 31:15
content: 15 Moses said to them, “Have you saved all the women alive?

title: Numbers 31:16
content: 16 Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against the LORD in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of the LORD.

title: Numbers 31:17
content: 17 Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known man by lying with him.

title: Numbers 31:18
content: 18 But all the girls, who have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.

title: Numbers 31:19
content: 19 “Encamp outside of the camp for seven days. Whoever has killed any person, and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, you and your captives.

title: Numbers 31:20
content: 20 You shall purify every garment, and all that is made of skin, and all work of goats’ hair, and all things made of wood.”

title: Numbers 31:21
content: 21 Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who went to the battle, “This is the statute of the law which the LORD has commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 31:22
content: 22 However the gold, and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,

title: Numbers 31:23
content: 23 everything that may withstand the fire, you shall make to go through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless it shall be purified with the water for impurity. All that doesn’t withstand the fire you shall make to go through the water.

title: Numbers 31:24
content: 24 You shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean. Afterward you shall come into the camp.”

title: Numbers 31:25
content: 25 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 31:26
content: 26 “Count the plunder that was taken, both of man and of animal, you, and Eleazar the priest, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the congregation;

title: Numbers 31:27
content: 27 and divide the plunder into two parts: between the men skilled in war, who went out to battle, and all the congregation.

title: Numbers 31:28
content: 28 Levy a tribute to the LORD of the men of war who went out to battle: one soul of five hundred; of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks.

title: Numbers 31:29
content: 29 Take it from their half, and give it to Eleazar the priest, for the LORD’s wave offering.

title: Numbers 31:30
content: 30 Of the children of Israel’s half, you shall take one drawn out of every fifty, of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, of all the livestock, and give them to the Levites, who perform the duty of the LORD’s tabernacle.”

title: Numbers 31:31
content: 31 Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 31:32
content: 32 Now the plunder, over and above the booty which the men of war took, was six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,

title: Numbers 31:33
content: 33 seventy-two thousand head of cattle,

title: Numbers 31:34
content: 34 sixty-one thousand donkeys,

title: Numbers 31:35
content: 35 and thirty-two thousand persons in all, of the women who had not known man by lying with him.

title: Numbers 31:36
content: 36 The half, which was the portion of those who went out to war, was in number three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep;

title: Numbers 31:37
content: 37 and the LORD’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred seventy-five.

title: Numbers 31:38
content: 38 The cattle were thirty-six thousand, of which the LORD’s tribute was seventy-two.

title: Numbers 31:39
content: 39 The donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which the LORD’s tribute was sixty-one.

title: Numbers 31:40
content: 40 The persons were sixteen thousand, of whom the LORD’s tribute was thirty-two persons.

title: Numbers 31:41
content: 41 Moses gave the tribute, which was the LORD’s wave offering, to Eleazar the priest, as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 31:42
content: 42 Of the children of Israel’s half, which Moses divided off from the men who fought

title: Numbers 31:43
content: 43 (now the congregation’s half was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,

title: Numbers 31:44
content: 44 thirty-six thousand head of cattle,

title: Numbers 31:45
content: 45 thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,

title: Numbers 31:46
content: 46 and sixteen thousand persons),

title: Numbers 31:47
content: 47 even of the children of Israel’s half, Moses took one drawn out of every fifty, both of man and of animal, and gave them to the Levites, who performed the duty of the LORD’s tabernacle, as the LORD commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 31:48
content: 48 The officers who were over the thousands of the army, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, came near to Moses.

title: Numbers 31:49
content: 49 They said to Moses, “Your servants have taken the sum of the men of war who are under our command, and there lacks not one man of us.

title: Numbers 31:50
content: 50 We have brought the LORD’s offering, what every man found: gold ornaments, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces, to make atonement for our souls before the LORD.”

title: Numbers 31:51
content: 51 Moses and Eleazar the priest took their gold, even all worked jewels.

title: Numbers 31:52
content: 52 All the gold of the wave offering that they offered up to the LORD, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred fifty shekels.

title: Numbers 31:53
content: 53 The men of war had taken booty, every man for himself.

title: Numbers 31:54
content: 54 Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the Tent of Meeting for a memorial for the children of Israel before the LORD.

title: Numbers 32:1
content: 1 Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock. They saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead. Behold, the place was a place for livestock.

title: Numbers 32:2
content: 2 Then the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the princes of the congregation, saying,

title: Numbers 32:3
content: 3 “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,

title: Numbers 32:4
content: 4 the land which the LORD struck before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock; and your servants have livestock.”

title: Numbers 32:5
content: 5 They said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession. Don’t bring us over the Jordan.”

title: Numbers 32:6
content: 6 Moses said to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, “Shall your brothers go to war while you sit here?

title: Numbers 32:7
content: 7 Why do you discourage the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the LORD has given them?

title: Numbers 32:8
content: 8 Your fathers did so when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.

title: Numbers 32:9
content: 9 For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which the LORD had given them.

title: Numbers 32:10
content: 10 The LORD’s anger burned in that day, and he swore, saying,

title: Numbers 32:11
content: 11 ‘Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me,

title: Numbers 32:12
content: 12 except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun, because they have followed the LORD completely.’

title: Numbers 32:13
content: 13 The LORD’s anger burned against Israel, and he made them wander back and forth in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation who had done evil in the LORD’s sight was consumed.

title: Numbers 32:14
content: 14 “Behold, you have risen up in your fathers’ place, an increase of sinful men, to increase the fierce anger of the LORD toward Israel.

title: Numbers 32:15
content: 15 For if you turn away from after him, he will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and you will destroy all these people.”

title: Numbers 32:16
content: 16 They came near to him, and said, “We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock, and cities for our little ones;

title: Numbers 32:17
content: 17 but we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel, until we have brought them to their place. Our little ones shall dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.

title: Numbers 32:18
content: 18 We will not return to our houses until the children of Israel have all received their inheritance.

title: Numbers 32:19
content: 19 For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this side of the Jordan eastward.”

title: Numbers 32:20
content: 20 Moses said to them: “If you will do this thing, if you will arm yourselves to go before the LORD to the war,

title: Numbers 32:21
content: 21 and every one of your armed men will pass over the Jordan before the LORD until he has driven out his enemies from before him,

title: Numbers 32:22
content: 22 and the land is subdued before the LORD; then afterward you shall return, and be clear of obligation to the LORD and to Israel. Then this land shall be your possession before the LORD.

title: Numbers 32:23
content: 23 “But if you will not do so, behold, you have sinned against the LORD; and be sure your sin will find you out.

title: Numbers 32:24
content: 24 Build cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which has proceeded out of your mouth.”

title: Numbers 32:25
content: 25 The children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.

title: Numbers 32:26
content: 26 Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock shall be there in the cities of Gilead;

title: Numbers 32:27
content: 27 but your servants will pass over, every man who is armed for war, before the LORD to battle, as my lord says.”

title: Numbers 32:28
content: 28 So Moses commanded concerning them to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers’ households of the tribes of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 32:29
content: 29 Moses said to them, “If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over the Jordan, every man who is armed to battle before the LORD, and the land is subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession;

title: Numbers 32:30
content: 30 but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”

title: Numbers 32:31
content: 31 The children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, “As the LORD has said to your servants, so will we do.

title: Numbers 32:32
content: 32 We will pass over armed before the LORD into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us beyond the Jordan.”

title: Numbers 32:33
content: 33 Moses gave to them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan; the land, according to its cities and borders, even the cities of the surrounding land.

title: Numbers 32:34
content: 34 The children of Gad built Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,

title: Numbers 32:35
content: 35 Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,

title: Numbers 32:36
content: 36 Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran: fortified cities and folds for sheep.

title: Numbers 32:37
content: 37 The children of Reuben built Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,

title: Numbers 32:38
content: 38 Nebo, and Baal Meon, (their names being changed), and Sibmah. They gave other names to the cities which they built.

title: Numbers 32:39
content: 39 The children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were therein.

title: Numbers 32:40
content: 40 Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh; and he lived therein.

title: Numbers 32:41
content: 41 Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its villages, and called them Havvoth Jair.

title: Numbers 32:42
content: 42 Nobah went and took Kenath and its villages, and called it Nobah, after his own name.

title: Numbers 33:1
content: 1 These are the journeys of the children of Israel, when they went out of the land of Egypt by their armies under the hand of Moses and Aaron.

title: Numbers 33:2
content: 2 Moses wrote the starting points of their journeys by the commandment of the LORD. These are their journeys according to their starting points.

title: Numbers 33:3
content: 3 They traveled from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the next day after the Passover, the children of Israel went out with a high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians,

title: Numbers 33:4
content: 4 while the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the LORD had struck among them. The LORD also executed judgments on their gods.

title: Numbers 33:5
content: 5 The children of Israel traveled from Rameses, and encamped in Succoth.

title: Numbers 33:6
content: 6 They traveled from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, which is in the edge of the wilderness.

title: Numbers 33:7
content: 7 They traveled from Etham, and turned back to Pihahiroth, which is before Baal Zephon, and they encamped before Migdol.

title: Numbers 33:8
content: 8 They traveled from before Hahiroth, and crossed through the middle of the sea into the wilderness. They went three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham, and encamped in Marah.

title: Numbers 33:9
content: 9 They traveled from Marah, and came to Elim. In Elim, there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they encamped there.

title: Numbers 33:10
content: 10 They traveled from Elim, and encamped by the Red Sea.

title: Numbers 33:11
content: 11 They traveled from the Red Sea, and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.

title: Numbers 33:12
content: 12 They traveled from the wilderness of Sin, and encamped in Dophkah.

title: Numbers 33:13
content: 13 They traveled from Dophkah, and encamped in Alush.

title: Numbers 33:14
content: 14 They traveled from Alush, and encamped in Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.

title: Numbers 33:15
content: 15 They traveled from Rephidim, and encamped in the wilderness of Sinai.

title: Numbers 33:16
content: 16 They traveled from the wilderness of Sinai, and encamped in Kibroth Hattaavah.

title: Numbers 33:17
content: 17 They traveled from Kibroth Hattaavah, and encamped in Hazeroth.

title: Numbers 33:18
content: 18 They traveled from Hazeroth, and encamped in Rithmah.

title: Numbers 33:19
content: 19 They traveled from Rithmah, and encamped in Rimmon Perez.

title: Numbers 33:20
content: 20 They traveled from Rimmon Perez, and encamped in Libnah.

title: Numbers 33:21
content: 21 They traveled from Libnah, and encamped in Rissah.

title: Numbers 33:22
content: 22 They traveled from Rissah, and encamped in Kehelathah.

title: Numbers 33:23
content: 23 They traveled from Kehelathah, and encamped in Mount Shepher.

title: Numbers 33:24
content: 24 They traveled from Mount Shepher, and encamped in Haradah.

title: Numbers 33:25
content: 25 They traveled from Haradah, and encamped in Makheloth.

title: Numbers 33:26
content: 26 They traveled from Makheloth, and encamped in Tahath.

title: Numbers 33:27
content: 27 They traveled from Tahath, and encamped in Terah.

title: Numbers 33:28
content: 28 They traveled from Terah, and encamped in Mithkah.

title: Numbers 33:29
content: 29 They traveled from Mithkah, and encamped in Hashmonah.

title: Numbers 33:30
content: 30 They traveled from Hashmonah, and encamped in Moseroth.

title: Numbers 33:31
content: 31 They traveled from Moseroth, and encamped in Bene Jaakan.

title: Numbers 33:32
content: 32 They traveled from Bene Jaakan, and encamped in Hor Haggidgad.

title: Numbers 33:33
content: 33 They traveled from Hor Haggidgad, and encamped in Jotbathah.

title: Numbers 33:34
content: 34 They traveled from Jotbathah, and encamped in Abronah.

title: Numbers 33:35
content: 35 They traveled from Abronah, and encamped in Ezion Geber.

title: Numbers 33:36
content: 36 They traveled from Ezion Geber, and encamped at Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.

title: Numbers 33:37
content: 37 They traveled from Kadesh, and encamped in Mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.

title: Numbers 33:38
content: 38 Aaron the priest went up into Mount Hor at the commandment of the LORD and died there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month, on the first day of the month.

title: Numbers 33:39
content: 39 Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died in Mount Hor.

title: Numbers 33:40
content: 40 The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the South in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 33:41
content: 41 They traveled from Mount Hor, and encamped in Zalmonah.

title: Numbers 33:42
content: 42 They traveled from Zalmonah, and encamped in Punon.

title: Numbers 33:43
content: 43 They traveled from Punon, and encamped in Oboth.

title: Numbers 33:44
content: 44 They traveled from Oboth, and encamped in Iye Abarim, in the border of Moab.

title: Numbers 33:45
content: 45 They traveled from Iyim, and encamped in Dibon Gad.

title: Numbers 33:46
content: 46 They traveled from Dibon Gad, and encamped in Almon Diblathaim.

title: Numbers 33:47
content: 47 They traveled from Almon Diblathaim, and encamped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.

title: Numbers 33:48
content: 48 They traveled from the mountains of Abarim, and encamped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers 33:49
content: 49 They encamped by the Jordan, from Beth Jeshimoth even to Abel Shittim in the plains of Moab.

title: Numbers 33:50
content: 50 The LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

title: Numbers 33:51
content: 51 Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, “When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

title: Numbers 33:52
content: 52 then you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, destroy all their stone idols, destroy all their molten images, and demolish all their high places.

title: Numbers 33:53
content: 53 You shall take possession of the land, and dwell therein; for I have given the land to you to possess it.

title: Numbers 33:54
content: 54 You shall inherit the land by lot according to your families; to the larger groups you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller you shall give a smaller inheritance. Wherever the lot falls to any man, that shall be his. You shall inherit according to the tribes of your fathers.

title: Numbers 33:55
content: 55 “But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those you let remain of them will be like pricks in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will harass you in the land in which you dwell.

title: Numbers 33:56
content: 56 It shall happen that as I thought to do to them, so I will do to you.”

title: Numbers 34:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 34:2
content: 2 “Command the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you come into the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall to you for an inheritance, even the land of Canaan according to its borders),

title: Numbers 34:3
content: 3 then your south quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin along by the side of Edom, and your south border shall be from the end of the Salt Sea eastward.

title: Numbers 34:4
content: 4 Your border shall turn about southward of the ascent of Akrabbim, and pass along to Zin; and it shall pass southward of Kadesh Barnea; and it shall go from there to Hazar Addar, and pass along to Azmon.

title: Numbers 34:5
content: 5 The border shall turn about from Azmon to the brook of Egypt, and it shall end at the sea.

title: Numbers 34:6
content: 6 “‘For the western border, you shall have the great sea and its border. This shall be your west border.

title: Numbers 34:7
content: 7 “‘This shall be your north border: from the great sea you shall mark out for yourselves Mount Hor.

title: Numbers 34:8
content: 8 From Mount Hor you shall mark out to the entrance of Hamath; and the border shall pass by Zedad.

title: Numbers 34:9
content: 9 Then the border shall go to Ziphron, and it shall end at Hazar Enan. This shall be your north border.

title: Numbers 34:10
content: 10 “‘You shall mark out your east border from Hazar Enan to Shepham.

title: Numbers 34:11
content: 11 The border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain. The border shall go down, and shall reach to the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward.

title: Numbers 34:12
content: 12 The border shall go down to the Jordan, and end at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to its borders around it.’”

title: Numbers 34:13
content: 13 Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, “This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which the LORD has commanded to give to the nine tribes, and to the half-tribe;

title: Numbers 34:14
content: 14 for the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their fathers’ houses, the tribe of the children of Gad according to their fathers’ houses, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.

title: Numbers 34:15
content: 15 The two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.”

title: Numbers 34:16
content: 16 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 34:17
content: 17 “These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.

title: Numbers 34:18
content: 18 You shall take one prince of every tribe, to divide the land for inheritance.

title: Numbers 34:19
content: 19 These are the names of the men: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

title: Numbers 34:20
content: 20 Of the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers 34:21
content: 21 Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.

title: Numbers 34:22
content: 22 Of the tribe of the children of Dan a prince, Bukki the son of Jogli.

title: Numbers 34:23
content: 23 Of the children of Joseph: of the tribe of the children of Manasseh a prince, Hanniel the son of Ephod.

title: Numbers 34:24
content: 24 Of the tribe of the children of Ephraim a prince, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.

title: Numbers 34:25
content: 25 Of the tribe of the children of Zebulun a prince, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.

title: Numbers 34:26
content: 26 Of the tribe of the children of Issachar a prince, Paltiel the son of Azzan.

title: Numbers 34:27
content: 27 Of the tribe of the children of Asher a prince, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.

title: Numbers 34:28
content: 28 Of the tribe of the children of Naphtali a prince, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.”

title: Numbers 34:29
content: 29 These are they whom the LORD commanded to divide the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.

title: Numbers 35:1
content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

title: Numbers 35:2
content: 2 “Command the children of Israel to give to the Levites cities to dwell in out of their inheritance. You shall give pasture lands for the cities around them to the Levites.

title: Numbers 35:3
content: 3 They shall have the cities to dwell in. Their pasture lands shall be for their livestock, and for their possessions, and for all their animals.

title: Numbers 35:4
content: 4 “The pasture lands of the cities, which you shall give to the Levites, shall be from the wall of the city and outward one thousand cubits around it.

title: Numbers 35:5
content: 5 You shall measure outside of the city for the east side two thousand cubits, and for the south side two thousand cubits, and for the west side two thousand cubits, and for the north side two thousand cubits, the city being in the middle. This shall be the pasture lands of their cities.

title: Numbers 35:6
content: 6 “The cities which you shall give to the Levites, they shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the man slayer to flee to. Besides them you shall give forty-two cities.

title: Numbers 35:7
content: 7 All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities together with their pasture lands.

title: Numbers 35:8
content: 8 Concerning the cities which you shall give of the possession of the children of Israel, from the many you shall take many, and from the few you shall take few. Everyone according to his inheritance which he inherits shall give some of his cities to the Levites.”

title: Numbers 35:9
content: 9 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 35:10
content: 10 “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

title: Numbers 35:11
content: 11 then you shall appoint for yourselves cities to be cities of refuge for you, that the man slayer who kills any person unwittingly may flee there.

title: Numbers 35:12
content: 12 The cities shall be for your refuge from the avenger, that the man slayer not die until he stands before the congregation for judgment.

title: Numbers 35:13
content: 13 The cities which you shall give shall be for you six cities of refuge.

title: Numbers 35:14
content: 14 You shall give three cities beyond the Jordan, and you shall give three cities in the land of Canaan. They shall be cities of refuge.

title: Numbers 35:15
content: 15 These six cities shall be refuge for the children of Israel, for the stranger, and for the foreigner living among them, that everyone who kills any person unwittingly may flee there.

title: Numbers 35:16
content: 16 “‘But if he struck him with an instrument of iron, so that he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.

title: Numbers 35:17
content: 17 If he struck him with a stone in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.

title: Numbers 35:18
content: 18 Or if he struck him with a weapon of wood in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.

title: Numbers 35:19
content: 19 The avenger of blood shall himself put the murderer to death. When he meets him, he shall put him to death.

title: Numbers 35:20
content: 20 If he shoved him out of hatred, or hurled something at him while lying in wait, so that he died,

title: Numbers 35:21
content: 21 or in hostility struck him with his hand, so that he died, he who struck him shall surely be put to death. He is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.

title: Numbers 35:22
content: 22 “‘But if he shoved him suddenly without hostility, or hurled on him anything without lying in wait,

title: Numbers 35:23
content: 23 or with any stone, by which a man may die, not seeing him, and cast it on him so that he died, and he was not his enemy and not seeking his harm,

title: Numbers 35:24
content: 24 then the congregation shall judge between the striker and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances.

title: Numbers 35:25
content: 25 The congregation shall deliver the man slayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge, where he had fled. He shall dwell therein until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.

title: Numbers 35:26
content: 26 “‘But if the man slayer shall at any time go beyond the border of his city of refuge where he flees,

title: Numbers 35:27
content: 27 and the avenger of blood finds him outside of the border of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the man slayer, he shall not be guilty of blood,

title: Numbers 35:28
content: 28 because he should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest, the man slayer shall return into the land of his possession.

title: Numbers 35:29
content: 29 “‘These things shall be for a statute and ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

title: Numbers 35:30
content: 30 “‘Whoever kills any person, the murderer shall be slain based on the testimony of witnesses; but one witness shall not testify alone against any person so that he dies.

title: Numbers 35:31
content: 31 “‘Moreover you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death. He shall surely be put to death.

title: Numbers 35:32
content: 32 “‘You shall take no ransom for him who has fled to his city of refuge, that he may come again to dwell in the land before the death of the priest.

title: Numbers 35:33
content: 33 “‘So you shall not pollute the land where you live; for blood pollutes the land. No atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, but by the blood of him who shed it.

title: Numbers 35:34
content: 34 You shall not defile the land which you inhabit, where I dwell; for I, the LORD, dwell among the children of Israel.’”

title: Numbers 36:1
content: 1 The heads of the fathers’ households of the family of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the princes, the heads of the fathers’ households of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers 36:2
content: 2 They said, “The LORD commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the children of Israel. My lord was commanded by the LORD to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.

title: Numbers 36:3
content: 3 If they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong. So it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.

title: Numbers 36:4
content: 4 When the jubilee of the children of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong. So their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”

title: Numbers 36:5
content: 5 Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the LORD’s word, saying, “The tribe of the sons of Joseph speak what is right.

title: Numbers 36:6
content: 6 This is the thing which the LORD commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them be married to whom they think best, only they shall marry into the family of the tribe of their father.

title: Numbers 36:7
content: 7 So shall no inheritance of the children of Israel move from tribe to tribe; for the children of Israel shall all keep the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

title: Numbers 36:8
content: 8 Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may each possess the inheritance of his fathers.

title: Numbers 36:9
content: 9 So shall no inheritance move from one tribe to another tribe; for the tribes of the children of Israel shall each keep his own inheritance.’”

title: Numbers 36:10
content: 10 The daughters of Zelophehad did as the LORD commanded Moses:

title: Numbers 36:11
content: 11 for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to their father’s brothers’ sons.

title: Numbers 36:12
content: 12 They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph. Their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.

title: Numbers 36:13
content: 13 These are the commandments and the ordinances which the LORD commanded by Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
